SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.platformer.escape_beyond.view

Class PlayerView

java.lang.Object
com.platformer.escape_beyond.view.PlayerView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class PlayerView extends Object implements Observer
The PlayerView class represents the visual representation of the player character in the game.

It observes the PlayerModel to dynamically update the player's position in the view whenever the model changes. This class also handles the initialization and mirroring of the player character.

Implements the Observer Pattern for syncing with the PlayerModel.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerView

      public PlayerView(javafx.scene.layout.Pane root, PlayerModel playerModel, int index)
      Constructs a PlayerView object that observes the PlayerModel and renders the player in the given pane.
      Parameters:
      root - The pane in which the player view will be rendered.
      playerModel - The player's model containing the player's state and coordinates.
      index - The index of the character image to load.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the player's view to match the current state of the PlayerModel.

      This method is triggered whenever the model notifies its observers of a change.

      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer

    • getPlayerNode

      public javafx.scene.Node getPlayerNode()
      Returns the graphical representation of the player as a Node.

      This method allows the player node to be added to a scene graph.

      Returns:
      The Node representing the player.

    • initPlayer

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView initPlayer(int x, int y, int index)
      Initializes the player's view by loading the corresponding character image and setting its properties.
      Parameters:
      x - The initial x-coordinate of the player.
      y - The initial y-coordinate of the player.
      index - The index of the character image to load.
      Returns:
      The initialized ImageView representing the player.

    • mirror

      public void mirror()
      Mirrors the player's image horizontally.

      If the player's image is already mirrored, this method resets it to its original orientation.
